member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.Document
member.summary: Wraps a file opened in SharpDevelop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.Document.Close(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes the document.
member.param: If true, the window is closed without giving the user a change to save changes if there were modifications.
member.returns: true, if the window has been closed

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.Document.FileName
member.summary: Gets the file name assigned to this document. Can be null.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.Document.Text
member.summary: Gets/Sets the text displayed in the document.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.Document.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets if the document tab has been disposed because the document has been closed.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost
member.summary: This class can host an instance of SharpDevelop inside another AppDomain.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.CreateDomain
member.summary: Create an AppDomain capable of hosting SharpDevelop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.CreateDomainSetup
member.summary: Creates an AppDomainSetup specifying properties for an AppDomain capable of hosting SharpDevelop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.#ctor(ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings)
member.summary: Create a new AppDomain to host SharpDevelop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.#ctor(System.AppDomain,ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings)
member.summary: Host SharpDevelop in the existing AppDomain.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.RunWorkbench(ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.WorkbenchSettings)
member.summary: Initializes the workbench (create the MainForm instance, construct menu from AddInTree etc.) and runs it using the supplied settings. This starts a new message loop for the workbench. By default the message loop is created on a new thread, but you can change the settings so that it is created on the thread calling RunWorkbench. In that case, RunWorkbench will block until SharpDevelop is shut down!

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.OpenDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the document with the specified file name. Requires that the workbench is running.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.OpenProject(System.String)
member.summary: Opens the project or solution with the specified file name. Requires that the workbench is running.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.IsSolutionOrProject(System.String)
member.summary: Gets if the specified file is a project or solution file.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.CloseWorkbench(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Closes and unloads the workbench. The user is asked to save his work and can abort closing. Requires that the workbench is running.
member.param: When force is used (=true), unsaved changes to documents are lost, but SharpDevelop still terminates correctly and saves changed settings.
member.returns: True when the workbench was closed.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.UnloadDomain
member.summary: Unload the SharpDevelop AppDomain. This will force SharpDevelop to close without saving open files or changed settings. Call CloseWorkbench before UnloadDomain to prompt the user to save documents and settings.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.CreateInstanceInTargetDomain``1(System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type argument in the target AppDomain.
member.param: Arguments to pass to the constructor of .

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.CreateInstanceInTargetDomain(System.Type,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates an instance of the specified type in the target AppDomain.
member.param: Type to create an instance of.
Arguments to pass to the constructor of .

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.OpenDocuments
member.summary: Gets the list of currently opened documents.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.WorkbenchVisible
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the workbench is visible. Requires that the workbench is running.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.AppDomain
member.summary: Gets the AppDomain used to host SharpDevelop.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.InvokeTarget
member.summary: Gets/Sets an object to use to synchronize all events with a thread. Use null (default) to handle all events on the thread they were raised on.

member.summary: Event before the workbench starts running.

member.name: E:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.WorkbenchClosed
member.summary: Event after the workbench has been unloaded.

member.summary: Event when SharpDevelop starts to compile a project or solution.

member.summary: Event when SharpDevelop finishes to compile a project or solution.

member.summary: Event when a solution was loaded inside SharpDevelop.

member.summary: Event when the current solution was closed.

member.name: E:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.SharpDevelopHost.SolutionConfigurationChanged
member.summary: Event when the active solution configuration was changed.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder
member.summary: Records log4net log messages to a cyclic buffer for the purpose of creating better error reports.

member.name: F:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.DefaultBufferSize
member.summary: Gets the default buffer size used by the recorder.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.Append(log4net.Core.LoggingEvent)
member.summary: Records a logging event.
member.remarks: This method is already thread-safe because the caller base.DoAppend holds a lock on this.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.AppendRecentLogMessages(System.Text.StringBuilder,log4net.ILog)
member.summary: Appends the recent log messages recorded by the to the specified .
member.param: The to append the rendered log messages to.
An that points to a logger which is in the repository that contains the appender.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.BufferSize
member.summary: Specifies how many log messages the recorder stores.
member.value: The size of the cyclic buffer for the recent log messages.
member.remarks: Setting this property clears the buffer.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.LogMessageRecorder.RecordedEvents
member.summary: Gets a read-only snapshot of the recorded events currently stored in the buffer. The returned collection contains the events in the same order as they have been appended.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.WorkbenchSettings
member.summary: This class contains properties to control how the SharpDevelop workbench is being run.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.WorkbenchSettings.RunOnNewThread
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether to create a new thread to run the workbench on. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.WorkbenchSettings.InitialFileList
member.summary: Put files to open at workbench startup into this collection.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.RunWorkbenchException
member.summary: Exception used when there's an unhandled exception running the workbench.

member.summary: Create a new RunWorkbenchException instance.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.RunWorkbenchException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new RunWorkbenchException instance.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.RunWorkbenchException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Create a new RunWorkbenchException instance.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.RunWorkbenchException.#ctor(System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo,System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext)
member.summary: Create a new RunWorkbenchException instance.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings
member.summary: This class contains properties you can use to control how SharpDevelop is launched.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.AddAddInsFromDirectory(System.String)
member.summary: Find AddIns by searching all .addin files recursively in .

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.AddAddInFile(System.String)
member.summary: Add the specified .addin file.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.ResourceAssemblyName
member.summary: Gets/Sets the name of the assembly to load the BitmapResources and English StringResources from.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.UseSharpDevelopErrorHandler
member.summary: Gets/Sets whether the SharpDevelop exception box should be used for unhandled exceptions. The default is true.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.AllowAddInConfigurationAndExternalAddIns
member.summary: Use the file \AddIns.xml to maintain a list of deactivated AddIns and list of AddIns to load from external locations. The default value is true.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.AllowUserAddIns
member.summary: Allow user AddIns stored in the "application data" directory. The default is false.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets/Sets the application name used by the MessageService and some SharpDevelop windows. The default is "SharpDevelop".

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.ApplicationRootPath
member.summary: Gets/Sets the application root path to use. Use null (default) to use the base directory of the SharpDevelop AppDomain.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.ConfigDirectory
member.summary: Gets/Sets the directory used to store SharpDevelop properties, settings and user AddIns. Use null (default) to use "ApplicationData\ApplicationName"

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.DataDirectory
member.summary: Sets the data directory used to load resources. Use null (default) to use the default path "ApplicationRootPath\data".

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.PropertiesName
member.summary: Sets the name used for the properties file (without path or extension). Use null (default) to use the default name.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.StartupSettings.DomPersistencePath
member.summary: Sets the directory used to store the code completion cache. Use null (default) to disable the code completion cache.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.FileEventArgs
member.summary: EventArgs for the SharpDevelopHost.FileLoaded and SharpDevelopHost.FileSaved events.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the FileEventArgs class.

member.name: P:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.FileEventArgs.FileName
member.summary: Gets the file name.

member.name: T:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.ExceptionBox
member.summary: Form used to display display unhandled errors in SharpDevelop.

member.name: M:ICSharpCode.SharpDevelop.Sda.ExceptionBox.#ctor(System.Exception,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a new ExceptionBox instance.
member.param: If is true, the continue button is not available.
